channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish, 19th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a cooker and chairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71;73;75;77;79;81, St Peters Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian lights constantly active, 19th January
item.description:
The traffic lights are working. But the pedestrian crossing is operating like the button is stuck on. The wait light is constantly on, and it's doing a pedestrian phase every cycle. The traffic is extra heavy as Copt Elm Road has been closed today and this is making it even worse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Large pothole, killed tire immediately!, 19th January
item.description:
There is a large pothole on the road. When our car passed over it, the tire was immediately punctured then went flat! This pothole was reported weeks ago, yet no action has been taken to repair it. During dark, rainy evenings, visibility is extremely poor, making it impossible to see the pothole until an incident occurs. This situation is extremely unsafe for road users and is completely unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes recently filled have reopened, 19th January
item.description:
Near the post box

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 19th January
item.description:
This pothole is impossible to miss and-at low-speed (under 30) created a huge bang. It would be really dangerous for cyclists and will damage cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Voxwell Lane, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Large pothole on side of road., 19th January
item.description:
I previously reported pothole in wrong location. I hit this pothole when it was dark earlier in the morning - photo in light taken for clearer picture. The location is heading from the air balloon junction on the leckhampton road just before turning to National Star Ullenwood Manor Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold

5/6 potholes all in the same area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Fields, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Significant leaf drop all over paths, 19th January
item.description:
Highway trees have dropped leaves as always happens in winter but GCC never clear them away leading to dangerously slippy footpaths, mess for residents and causing build up in drainage swales
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beamont Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on left of road with timber place in yiur right, after Aldi on your right. A long stretch on left side and centre of the road. Atrocious, dangerous, diabolical etc. You can't drive safely in that direction towards Pilgrove Way. The current multiple puddles show how many potholes are on this road. I tried ringing the emergency number, but no answer. The whole stretch of the road needs resurfacing, so that it lasts!!, 19th January
item.description:
Have identified whole location in previous box. On Hayden /Old Gloucester Road from just after Timber Walden business in the direction of The House in the Tree. It's really dangerous right up to the keft turn into Pilgrove way, all the he left lane and the centre of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed footpath around manhole, 19th January
item.description:
Adjacent the lozenge as you enter Coopers Edge on the left, manhole in footpath is significantly above the level of footpath which has collapsed - been like this for years and is a danger to pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beamont Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
